div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

span.p: Monday, March 16, 2020
Happy birthday to Ethan Meyer, Anneliese Bangert, Brianna Hornback, Payton Watson, Mrs. Depenbrock, and Mrs. Honecker-Ummel.
All students bringing a non L-P guest to Prom must have a completed Guest Request Form on file in the deans office by Monday, March 23rd. Forms can be picked up at the Greeters Desk.

There will be an intramural 3 on 3 basketball tournament on Thursday, March 19th at 6:30 in the Sellett Gym. Sign your team of up to 4 people up outside the PE office. Any questions, see Coach Keating.

The Oral Cancer Foundation has a Fundraiser event on Sunday, April 26th. It is at St. Bede Academy. Volunteers are needed from 7-8:15am to help decorate the lane leading up to the school. Community service hours will be awarded. If interested, please email nita.ocf.il@gmail.com.
There will be a GSA meeting tomorrow after school in room #331! Snacks provided. Hope to see YOU there!
Junior Board Members: All candy money is due to Mrs. Hartman by Wednesday, March 18.
Debate clubwill meet on Monday after school in room 114 at 2:45. We hope to see you there!
Group Interpretationwill meet on Wednesday in room 114 at 7:15 a.m. We hope you join us!
Key Club will be meeting at 7:15 AM on Tuesday morning in the Cavalier Community Room.
A scholarship for graduates of Dimmick grade school is now available to eligible seniors. Please visit the counseling office for more information.
Attention seniors: Remember to check the lphs.net website for recent posting of scholarships.
Summer School driver ed applications and money has been extended to this Wednesday, May 18th. Forms are available in the Counseling office.

Great news, Cavs! Not only is the Poetry Slam/Open Mic Night just 2 weeks away, but the deadline for submitting the text youd like to perform has been extended to Thursday, March 26. Submit your piece to Mrs. Phillips or Ms. Ewald. Even if the stage isnt your thing, come to the beautiful Matthiesen Auditorium on Monday, March 30 at 6 p.m. to support your fellow students, teachers and alumni who will be performing. Along with the Poetry Slam, there will be artwork displayed in the hallway. If youd like a piece to be included with the art in the hallway, please see Mrs. Sarver.

There will be a bass fishing meeting on Tuesday March 17th in the driver ed room at 2:50pm. In order to participate in the sectional you must attend each meeting. If you have any question, please see coach Cherveny.
The following college representatives will be here this month:
Tuesday, March 17 Army National Guard will be here during all of 5th hour.
Thursday, March 19 a representative from ISAC periods 3 5b
Tuesday, March 24 Aurora University 3rd hour
Interested students can sign up in the Counseling office to meet with any of these representatives.

a.title: Go to comments for Monday, March 16, 2020

span.p: Friday, March 13, 2020
Happy birthday to Beatriz Arce, Cory Castaneda, Emma Gochanour, Cooper Vaske, Ashlyn Billings, Zane Billings, Francesca Eggersdorfer, Lucio Vazquez, and Madison Wrobleski.

a.title: Go to comments for Friday, March 13, 2020

img.alt: A group of high scholarship students sitting in Sellett Gym.

div.p: Numerous academically exceptional LPHS students were recognized for accumulating multiple semesters of high scholarship status at the High Scholarship Legion Honors Program in Matthiessen Memorial Auditorium on February 27, 2020.

a.title: Go to comments for High Scholarship Students Recognized

a.span: LPHS Announces Honor Roll & High Scholarship

div.p: We are excited to announce the first semester Honor Roll and High Scholarship lists for the 2019-2020 school year.

a.title: Go to comments for LPHS Announces Honor Roll & High Scholarship

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

img.title: Graphic featuring a picture of superintendent Dr. Steven Wrobleski.
img.alt: Graphic featuring a picture of superintendent Dr. Steven Wrobleski.

h3.em: I am honored to lead a district so rich in history, yet dedicated to offering innovative programs designed to inspire learning. Our Board of Education supports and promotes strong academic and vocational course offerings balanced with a wide-array of extracurricular and fine arts experiences. It is our promise to deliver opportunities for students to serve their communities, become problem-solvers and strong communicators, and demonstrate care for themselves and others.
